question: From the diagram
images/2024-chem-55-1.png
, <katex>$\Delta H$</katex> for the reaction <katex>$C\rightarrow A$</katex> is [cite: 419, 428]
explanation: From Hess's Law: <katex>$\Delta H (A \rightarrow 2B) = +10$</katex>. <katex>$\Delta H (2B \rightarrow C) = +25$</katex>. So <katex>$\Delta H (A \rightarrow C) = 10 + 25 = 35$</katex>. Then <katex>$\Delta H (C \rightarrow A) = -35$</katex> J. [cite: 430, 431]
